pros: Great colleagues, work environment, amenities.
cons: Slow, inefficient, not good HR services.

job_title: Tenured Full Professor in Bremerton, WA
pros: Great faculty concerned and focused on all students learning.
cons: Community colleges and their staffs are the least valued sector of public education throughout the US.

job_title: Childcare program coordinator  in Bremerton, WA
pros: Free education in some programs Nice work hours Good vacation
cons: Terrible pay No room for advancement Slow or No follow through from administration HR department in shambles

pros: Boss at the time was very nice. Job responsibilities fairly easy. Students usually very nice. They were also incredibly understanding about me needing to miss work if it pertained to my schoolwork.
cons: Pay was awful and they were very strict about hours. No benefits. Sometimes felt like the college was having an identity crisis on what they wanted the help desk to have. Not a lot of materials on how to handle situations.

pros: There are many amazing faculty and staff who really care about students and are very dedicated to the mission.
cons: Unfortunately, there's a culture of incivility that is allowed to thrive making it a very challenging place to work.

pros:
Nice campus. Good food at the cafeteria.
A lot employees want to help and work with you to solve problems
Can be a well oiled machine depending on who you work with
I had a good team of people for the first 2 years that I worked with. I made some good friendships and felt apart of a work family for the first time ever.
cons:
There are a lot of people in positions of power and/or who have seniority who do absolutely nothing, push all of their responsibilities on their assistants/other coworkers, understaff their departments, and use bureaucracy as excuses to not improve student and employee lives. I have personally been verbally abused and mistreated by people like this within the institute, with other employees telling me to not get on their bad side because "they have seniority", insinuating they will use their position of perceived power to make my job a living h---, which they did.

They will promise to give you full time employment but they will never deliver - ever. Unless you apply for another position within the college, you will not get full time. I was promised full time for 3 years - nada, and no raise either. 

You will never get a raise. They will make excuses as to why you will never get one. You can out perform everyone else on your team or do more than what is expected time and time again, you will never get a raise.

If the minimum wage increases, your wages will not. Your position could pay $5 over minimum wage, but if the minimum wage goes up, you're pay will stay the same. Basically, you're getting a pay cut. You bring this up and they will say they won't change anything.

They are not transparent publicly about their employment stats. A vast majority (over 60%) of the people employed through Olympic College are part time and, once again, they do not make part timers to full timers ever. 

Productivity comes second to out-dated professionalism practices.

Example 1. You are not allowed to close your office door. This may be different for different departments, but in the one I worked in if I had my door slightly ajar or straight up closed, I would get in trouble. I can get overwhelmed by stimuli often and my office was frequently loud and full of people talking super loudly or even straight up yelling, which would distract me from my work. I explained that I needed to close my door in order to focus and I was told I could not. If I wore headphones, it was tolerated but sometimes they would comment on how inconvenient that is for them. I would be ignored for several hours every day, no one checking on me or anything, but the moment my door was even slightly closed suddenly management would be at my door telling me not to do that. I would have a coworker screaming into their phone in their office next door to me, absolutely driving me mad and distracting me from my work, but if I closed my door to dry to separate myself from it or if I asked them to stop yelling, I would be yelled at by management. Ridiculous. 

Example 2. If you are even slightly curt in an email chain towards someone who is being purposefully obtuse in their role, everyone will be mad at you for calling the BS out rather than being mad at the person who is intentionally standing in the way of institutional effectiveness. People who are purposefully obtuse in their positions are even defended by other employees even though those employees also hate their behavior! But I guess rocking the boat is worse than trying to make any long lasting changes systemically.

I worked at OC for 3 years. By the time I left, all of the coworkers I had started with and loved were gone (driven away, frankly). It was sad.

pros: The people are great. The campus is clean.
cons: It's a community college that should be promoting jobs in the community. Some of the classes and the way the courses are taught are not utilizing the most current technology.

pros:
No set hours.
Professional development offered.
Consistent pay.
cons: Not full time and no benefits offered for my position.

pros: Amazing manager to work with. It was very flexible
cons: No cons to say about this job

pros: Did work study so it paid for some of my classes
cons: Can be a toxic environment sometimes, payroll system is janky and convoluted, unless you're full time and a direct hire (meaning NOT part time, and NOT work study), you get zero benefits.

job_title: Office Specialist III in Bremerton, WA
pros: Friendly, Professional, Efficient, Kind, Generous, Exemplary leadership
cons: Can't think of any negatives

pros: They will work around most any schedules you may have.
cons: Poor Communication, no raises except for cost of living raises, no upward movement even possible, especially if you work at the Poulsbo campus or the Shelton Campus. If you work at the minor campuses its like you don't really exist to the bosses.

review_title: State benefits, many nice people but with many difficult people as well
pros: State benefits that include holidays, vacation, retirement.
cons: Culture of negativity at times

job_title: Circulation Desk Assistant in Bremerton, WA
pros: It was a ton of fun working with everyone and learning from them. Hours were great, access to all new books and old books.
cons: The library is public and not just for the school which can create issues. People, patrons, always try to put the books back in order but it is just easier if they leave them on the cart at the end of the aisle for employees to take care of.

pros:
nice work culture.
Easy to pick up hours or drop them
cons: no cons at olmypic college

job_title: Student financial manager in Bremerton, WA
pros: Great Benefits offered for working for the state, retirement plan is aggressive with a progressive mandatory contribution. Job security
cons: State Board computer software is not fully developed even though it is being progressively implemented at all 34 colleges in the system

pros: Nice people to work for.
cons: A pretty run down location in Bremerton Washington.

review_title: Great place to get your feet wet in higher edcuation.
pros: Flexible schedule, transparency in the day to day, hard working coworkers.
cons: As a tutor I have no mobility of job prospects.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Kitsap Lake, WA
pros: Great colleagues to work with.
cons: There are way too many administrators.

review_title: Zero career advancement, heavy Faculty bias
pros: Fun people, learning environment, beautiful campus
cons: I worked here about 11 years. It is next to impossible to work your way up or advance your career. Absolute preference is given to faculty, while administrative staff are regarded as less then. Faculty treat staff horribly, and OC leadership does nothing about it. The staff are the hearts blood of the campus and are the reason it runs! But Faculty rule it... even leadership are afraid of a tenured professor! The pay is lower then average, but there are very small but guaranteed increments year after year. The health and dental benefit package options are not bad. Beware of micromanaging superiors! Its awful and rampant. Nobody ever gets fired, so employees treat other how they please. I never realized how unhealthy that place was until I left. It felt like a weight lifted right off me and I could breath again. I went on elsewhere  to makeover double the salary I made there with my 11 years of experience. Use it as a stepping stone if you can. You may get lucky and have an amazing boss and supportive team, but likely you will have the opposite and will deal with horrid campus politics, slave like treatment from faculty, and absolutely nobody will value the work you do apart from those working closest to you.

job_title: Customer Service Specialist I in Bremerton, WA
pros: Open community, friendly, everyone knows each other.
cons: During the quarter the Parking is sparse

pros: State benefits are quite good. Limited tuition waivers for Olympic College classes, not necessarily job-related, are great if you can use them. Lots to choose from including evening art classes. Lots of quirky, hard-working co-workers. Interesting special events are fairly frequent.
cons: State salaries are not very good except information technology or tenured faculty. Raises are small and infrequent. Workloads are unrealistic. Too many of the administrators are workaholics. The main problem with that is the more work they do, the more upper management piles on them. Never enough time to take advantage of the interesting special events.

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros:
Learned go customer service skills and a wide range of computer and IT skills. Everyday was different. 
Much better than working in the computer labs!
cons: New hires are put on the phone immediately. No training, just handed a notebook of policies to study, but there's no time on the clock and off the clock I was a full-time student with a family. Got yelled at by second in command when she came back from medical leave because I wasn't fully trained yet and no one was following procedures while she was gone (basically I was the only one dumb enough to be in the office when she arrived and faced the torrent of frustration).

pros: It's a state job...that's about the only pro. The grounds look well taken care of, have some nice people there
cons: Unfair hiring practices, favoritism, and preference for retired people with no families. People in management positions yelling at people with disabilities. If you're not a multi cultural student then you're not considered a person. No sense of community

pros: There is a really good work/life balance. If you have a good manager it could be better, but over time you will come to find why a chunk of OC's employees are very unhappy.
cons: Management doesn't care about their employees and keep around higher level administration that bully and overwork their lower level employees.

job_title: Teacher, Secondary School in Bremerton, WA
pros: As the economy gets worse, enrollment goes up.  As enrollment goes up, so does the availability of excess enrollment dollars.  This results in quite a bit of prosperity at the college while the rest of the economy is suffering.  This makes a career at Olympic College practically recession-proof.
cons: Change happens very slowly at Olympic College, where the average employee has more than 15 years of service.  This sometimes results in a sense of institutional ennui, which can be hard to overcome.

review_title: OC IT Help Desk: Great place to work while going to school!
job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Bremerton, WA
pros:
Set hours. Flexible. Rewarding work. Option to work up to 40 hours a week in between quarters. 

Overall it's been a great place to work. Everyone starts out working phones, but the longer you are there, the more fun and interesting things you get to do. Helping fix people's computer issues is personally rewarding, and making people smile always brightens your day.
cons: Work can be slow at times.

pros: Decent pay for level of work, lot's of downtime to read, do homework, etc, fairly easy job, good management, flexible schedule, lots of autonomy.
cons: Can get really monotonous, hours were kind of weird because they were based on class schedules, hours fluctuated a lot between quarters.

review_title: Classified staff are treated poorly. Faculty run the college and the Administrators cater to them.
pros: Most all of the Classified staff here are wonderful people who are very nice to work with. Benefits are ok.
cons: Faculty memberf "rule" the college, they get what they want, they treat others horribly and the administrators do nothing baout it because they worry about creating issues.

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Bremerton, WA
pros: Willing to work to accommodate class schedule when possible. Learned a lot about hiring procedures as well as information about job search resources.
cons: There were some very slow days where there wasn't always a lot of work to do, so it could get boring at times. Must pace yourself so you don't finish daily work too fast.

review_title: Solid and flexible, good to get your feet wet.
pros: Most the people I worked with were awesome. Students were friendly. Definitely room for growth as a worker. The hours are flexible.
cons: You can't grow too much while expecting the pay. Without much money flowing through on campus, full time positions are rare. Sometimes there's also drama between departments, but that's been rare.

pros: None, kids do have a place to go to school.
cons: No managerial support, unions just want to fight, employees trust nothing, President does not lead - worst environment!  Avoid it at all costs.  It says a lot when enrollment is down, and all VP positions are  are "acting" or temporary and have been that way for years.

pros: Some great people at all levels. Great benefits. It is a college campus!
cons: Going through some difficult leadership transitions. Stressful relations between admin and  union staff.

pros: Willingness to work with class schedule as needed, plenty of new people to meet, and the tasks were never over demanding. The managing staff was some of the best I'd ever worked for.
cons: Capped maximum hours per month, but that was a state level mandate and not their fault.

pros: Good benefits including retirement and leave. Reliable workplace and have some nice people to work with. Have a chance to be a better workplace.
cons: Slow with change and salary low. Need to be more student centered. Stagnant progress to streamline process. Overwork workforce and low resources.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Bremerton, WA
pros: The teaching staff is qualified, friendly, and always ready to help.
cons: HR is extremely incompetent. They don't bother to incorporate any of the documents filled out at orientation to the employee files; they don't communicate well with Payroll or Facilities, and consistently give new employees wrong information.

review_title: Adequate for a current college student
pros: Hours will work around your school schedule. No dress code. A good chance to practice and review classes I've already taken.
cons: Many of the tutors are HS running start students, so the level of professionalism is quite low.

review_title: Welcoming atmosphere that's willing to work around your school or other work schedule
